Utils

The GUI utilities, its made up of several classes and functions

Classes

class GUI.guiutils.ToolTip(widget: Widget)

A class to creat tooltips when hovering on any tkinter element.

Parameters

widget – widget that generates the tooltip.

class GUI.guiutils.ExperimentBanner(frame: Frame, bannertext: str, experiment_name: str, laps: int, dataset: str, embeddings: list, single_rel_check: bool, single_rel_name: str, lapstext='laps')

A class to create Banners (tkinter labelframes) to add to the setup menu. They display information about which tests and experiments are queued to run.

Parameters

  • frame – the parent frame to attach the banner to.

  • bannertext – the text to display on top of the labelframe.

  • experiment_name – the name of the test or experiment to run.

  • laps – the number of episodes/laps the experiment/training is goin to run for.

  • dataset – the dataset which is being relied upon

  • embeddings – the embeddings that are ging to be used.

  • single_rel_check – flag for single relation

  • single_rel_name – name of the relation to test/train.

  • lapstext – special parameter to indicate if laps should be something else (I.E. “episodes”)

class GUI.guiutils.AgentInfo(name: str, embeddings: list, dataset: str, is_single_rel: bool, single_rel_name: str)

A holder class for agent information

Parameters

  • name – the name of the test or experiment to run.

  • embeddings – the embeddings that are ging to be used.

  • dataset – the dataset which is being relied upon.

  • is_single_rel – flag for single relation.

  • single_rel_name – name of the relation to test/train.

Functions

class GUI.guiutils.CreateToolTip(widget: Widget, text: str)

Creates a tooltip for the selected widget with the specified text.

Parameters

  • widget – widget that generates the tooltip.

  • text – text to display in the tooltip.

class GUI.guiutils.GetConfig(is_experiments: bool)

Imports the configuration information and

Parameters

is_experiments – if we want to retrieve experiments or tests.

Returns

the configuration dictionary.

class GUI.guiutils.GetDatasets

Gets all available dataset names.

Returns

all available datasets.

class GUI.guiutils.GetAgents

Gets all agents that have been created and the config used for them, then encapsulates them in a AgentInfo class

Returns

a list of AgentInfo which contains all generated agents and information about them.

class GUI.guiutils.GetExperimentInstance(name: str, dataset: str, embeddings: list, laps: int, single_rel: bool, single_rel_name: str)

Create an experiment class object with the given information

Parameters

  • name – the experiment name

  • dataset – the dataset which is being relied upon.

  • embeddings – the embeddings that are ging to be used.

  • laps – the number of laps to perform

  • single_rel – flag for single relation.

  • single_rel_name – name of the relation to test/train.

Returns

the created Experiment object instance.

class GUI.guiutils.GetTestInstance(agentname: str, testname: str, embeddings: list, episodes: int)

Create a Test class object with the given information

Parameters

  • agentname – the name of the agent to test.

  • testname – the test name.

  • embeddings – the embeddings that are ging to be used.

  • episodes – the number of episodes to test for.

Returns

the created Test object instance.

class GUI.guiutils.CheckForRelationInDataset(dataset_name: str, relation_name: str)

checks for a particular relation in a dataset

Parameters

  • dataset_name – the name of the dataset

  • relation_name – the name of the relation

Returns

True if the relation is in the dataset, False otherwise.

class GUI.guiutils.CheckAgentNameColision(name: str)

checks if an agent with the requested name does already exist.

Parameters

name – the name of the agent.

Returns

True if the agent exists, False otherwise.

class GUI.guiutils.CheckTestCollision(name)

checks if a test with the requested name does already exist.

Parameters

name – the name of the test.

Returns

True if the test exists, False otherwise.

class GUI.guiutils.run_integrity_checks

checks for consistency in folders, in case a test/train suite has faield to complete.

class GUI.guiutils.remove_folders(path_abs: str, filecount: int)

deletes a folder with the indicated filecount.
